title: Teaser CTA screen before Valentine proposal

requirements.summary: Add an initial teaser screen that shows only a prominent link-style call-to-action labeled exactly "Click here for a surprise" before revealing the proposal UI.
acceptanceCriteria: On first page load, the Valentine question and Yes/No buttons are not visible.
The initial screen prominently displays the exact text: "Click here for a surprise".
The initial call-to-action is keyboard accessible (can be activated via Enter/Space) and clearly indicates it is clickable.

file_operations.description: Introduce a local "revealed" (or similar) UI state so the component initially renders only a centered, prominent link-style Button whose visible label is exactly "Click here for a surprise"; ensure it is rendered as a semantic <button> (keyboard-activatable by default) and visually indicates clickability (e.g., underline/link styling) while keeping the proposal card and interactions hidden until revealed. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: On teaser activation, transition to the existing Valentine proposal experience with the current question, Yes/No behavior, and animations unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: After clicking/tapping the teaser link, the Valentine proposal card appears with the existing question text and Yes/No buttons.
The existing playful "No" behavior continues to work as it does now (random messages, movement after threshold).
The existing "Yes" acceptance state and heart animation still work.

file_operations.description: Wire the teaser CTA onClick to switch into the existing proposal rendering path, preserving current state logic for accepted/noClickCount/noMessage/no movement and the heart animation; add only a light UI transition (e.g., opacity/scale via Tailwind classes) around conditional rendering so the experience feels like a reveal without changing the existing proposal behaviors. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Keep the Share section available and functional after the teaser is revealed, continuing to copy the current URL and a prefilled English message referencing the surprise link.
acceptanceCriteria: After revealing the proposal, the Share section is visible and functional.
Copy Link continues to copy the current page URL.
Copy Message continues to copy an English message including the existing wording about clicking the link for a surprise.

file_operations.description: Conditionally render <ShareSection /> only within the revealed proposal experience (i.e., not on the initial teaser-only screen), ensuring it remains present and reachable once the proposal UI is shown. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure the prefilled copied message remains in English and explicitly includes the existing wording about clicking the link for a surprise, while continuing to copy window.location.href for the URL and keeping the current clipboard/fallback behavior intact. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
